terms.definition: The 'server-side' of a website, responsible for database management and logic, often utilizing PHP.
terms.example: The backend handles all the database operations.

terms.definition: (Application Programming Interface) A set of rules that allows two pieces of software to communicate with each other.
terms.example: The mobile app uses an API to fetch data from the server.

terms.definition: A widely used, open-source relational database management system (RDBMS).
terms.translation: Sistema de gestión de bases de datos relacional
terms.example: Our application stores user data in a MySQL database.

terms.definition: The visible area of a web page on a device, crucial for Responsive Web Design.
terms.example: The viewport meta tag controls the layout on mobile devices.

terms.definition: The process of identifying, analyzing, and removing errors (bugs) from computer hardware or software.
terms.example: I spent all night debugging the payment processing code.

terms.definition: Git is a version control system; GitHub is a platform used to host and collaborate on Git repositories.
terms.translation: Sistema de control de versiones / Plataforma de alojamiento de código
terms.example: We use GitHub to manage our project's source code and track issues.
